topic: Assisted suicide should be a criminal offence
argument: {'terminally ill patients who just don t want to continue suffering have a valid reason to contemplate suicide  and someone who wants to help ease their pain should not be punished ', 'it shouldn t be an offence because is someone is seriously ill and in pain they have the right to end their own life if they are suffering ', 'if a patient is suffering with cancer or other painful conditions  they should have a right to end their suffering', 'people should be free to help people out of their pain by helping them commit suicide without the fear of prosecution', 'a person has the right to end their suffering and if somebody takes pity on them and chooses to help  that person should not be punished ', 'assisted suicide is a personal choice on how a person wants to live his or her life and therefore should be legal by the constitution', 'people should have the right to decide how and when they want to die  particularly if they are suffering from a terminal illness', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence if the patients asking for it to be done to them', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense because if someone is in enough pain and is sane enough to decide  they should have that choice ', 'If a person was terminally ill and no treatments were working on them and they have only weeks to live  than assisted suicide should be a way out ', 'assisted suicide should not be a crime since the perpetrator was merely obeying the wishes of another ', 'some patients have the utmost suffering and must end it as soon as possible', 'if someone is suffering so much that they see suicide as the only way out  then criminalising their behaviour is likely to do more harm than good ', 'assisted suicide shouldn t be a criminal offence because it allows the patient to have control over their final decisions', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense since it should be a personal decision what a person wants for themselves  it could prevent months or years of pain for someone with no quality of life ', 'assisted suicide is a lot better than letting a person suffer until end of life ', 'to enable a very sick individual to end their life should be seen as an act of kindness not a criminal offence as it takes great strength of character to be that enabler in what is a very difficult time ', 'assisted suicide would relieve much suffering by those with a terminal illness that is too much to bear ', 'if to a reasonable degree of medical certainty the medical condition of a person is irreversible  it must have the right to terminate his life by requesting assistance without consequences for the fact ', 'if to a degree of reasonable certainty the state of seriousness can not be reversed by the medicine  the patient must have the right to end his life and if he needs help for that he should not be condemned', 'assisted suicide shouldn t be a criminal offence because sometimes the person is in such pain or has no life just laying around in a bed', 'assisted suicide is a compassionate way to help people choosing to end their life in a nonviolent way ', 'assisted suicide shouldn t be a criminal offence because every human being should have the right to have someone assist them in passing should they determine they no longer wish to live', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence  because if a loved one is terminally ill  it provides them with the opportunity to die with dignity rather than suffering until they die naturally ', 'Assisted suicide helps those who are in pain due to a devastating disease end their own lives on their own terms ', 'people who have terminal illness or suffer from certain medical conditions should have the freedom to choose and if medical personnel helps them it shouldn t be treated as offence ', 'there are people who suffer from terrible illnesses who are mentally capable of saying  enough is enough   there is a realization that quality of life is so poor that death is a better option ', 'assisted suicide is a great help for people who suffer from deadly diseases and are on their deathbed', 'assisted suicide should be allowed because it allows people with terminal illnesses to die with dignity before suffering a long and painful death ', 'People and family members must decide what they want to do with their life and body', 'assisted suicide allows terminally ill persons to choose when to die and do it with dignity  it lets people decide not to live in a state of pain and misery and choose to pass on with human intervention ', 'assisted suicide is a blessing not a crime  a person who wants to be assisted in this is in great pain or has no ability to be cured  let someone give the suffering the chance to end it ', 'people should have the right to die  some people who are severely suffering without hope should be able to end their lives  sometimes this cannot be done without assistance ', 'if someone has an illness and is in constant pain  helping them end their misery is the humane thing to do and should be understood ', 'a person should have the right to be able to choose if they want to live or die', 'If a person only has weeks to live  then assisted suicide may be the answer if all other possibilities have been exhaussted ', 'assisted suicide is a humane and caring way to allow a person to help another person whose life is too difficult to be lived properly in any manner  so it should not be criminalized ', 'if a person who is dying anyway wants to end their life in a peaceful way then they should be able to do so ', 'people have the right to their bodies and if they wish to die they should be able to get help to do so ', 'people who are terminally ill with no hope of survival should be spared the pain and suffering of living ', 'if a terminally ill patient does not have assisted suicide available they may turn to another more violent method of ending their own life ', 'assisted suicide allows terminally ill people to die with dignity and should not be criminalized', 'assisted suicide allows one to end terminal pain and suffering and should be allowed to continue ', 'people have a basic right to bodily autonomy  deciding whether or not to die with minimal suffering and dignity is integral to that right ', 'people who are suffering with terminal illnesses with no hope of cure and in immense pain should be allowed to end their suffering  it s safer and painless done in a doctor s care rather than their own devices ', 'assisted suicide gives people control over their life in terrible circumstances  it allows them dignity in death rather than living in terrible conditions for many years ', 'the end of life can be painful and humiliating  and we should allow people the right to decide when they are ready to end their own suffering ', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence because it is sometimes the only way a person suffering a debilitating medical condition such as motor neurone disease can end there life ', 'a person should have the right to die on their own terms', 'to assist a loved one to pass on and be relieved of suffering is a selfless act that should not be criminalised ', 'assisted suicide should be allowed in certain circumstances such as when a person is suffering from severe illnesses ', 'Assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence as people with no quality of life should not have to suffer indefinitely and their trusted helper should not be a criminal for helping them ', 'People should be able to ask for help in ending their own life if they are living with an incurable disease ', 'assisted suicide must be allowed  if a terminally ill person wants to end their life  allow them the peace of being able to with the help of a professional instead of potentially making it worse on their own ', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense because it helps people who are in constant pain due to a terminal illness', 'assisting a suicide for medical reasons should not be considered a criminal offense because the person is making sound judgements based on someone else s suffering ', 'Death with dignity is having the option to decide your own fate  You re able to take control of your own fate  It allows you to leave the world with your true self intact ', 'assisted suicide is necessary in our modern world full of people dealing with pain and sorrow', 'Sometimes people are so ill they have no quality of life and want to end it themselves but are physically unable ot do so  in thee cases it is only merciful for it to be legal for someone to help them ', 'being able to die with dignity should be a right  when someone thinks their time has come  they should be able to die comfortable without worrying if having their loved ones nearby would get them jail time ', 'people whose quality of life is so poor that death would be preferable should be allowed to choose assisted suicide to end their suffering and pass with dignity', 'Some diseases are life threatening and can put a person in a no living state  These situations are hard to bear for the ill person and for his family and relatives  only assisted suicide can make this ease', 'assisted suicide helps terminally ill people end their suffering', 'Assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence as people should not be expected to live in vegetative states and need help to make their own decisions to die a reality ', 'a person should not be forced into having to live their lives suffering  when death is already enevitable', ' people reach their limit when it comes to their quality of life and should be able to end their suffering  this can be done with little or no suffering by assistance and the person is able to say good bye ', 'assisted suicide should not be a crime  if someone is suffering on a daily basis from something that they are going to die from anyway  they should be allowed to die on their own terms ', 'everyone should have the right to chose the direction they want to take  if someone is in unbearable pain with no quality of life then they should have the right to seek assistance ', 'sometimes people who are unable to end their own lives  are in so much pain and anguish that it is cruel to make them keep living  their loved ones need to be able to help them legally ', 'Assisted suicide and the right to live with dignity is a human right and should be made legal everywhere  It is a human right to choose not to suffer with a terminal illness ', 'if people has a life ending illness they should be allowed to die', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal defense because in some cases  like people who have terminal cancer  you are doing them a mercy and saving them from suffering ', 'assisted suicide is a humane way to end a life as we do with animals in pain and should not be a criminal offence ', 'when people are suffering  it is unfair to force them to continue to do so  if someone can assist them in ending the suffering  they should be able to ', 'if someone is suffering from an incurable disease and is in great pain  it can be humane to help end their suffering ', 'A patient should be able to decide when they have had enough  care  ', 'assisted suicide is a human right and would spare the terminally i ll pain ', 'assisted suicides are less painful and are an act of mercy', 'people willing to die  it s their choice  should be able to leave this world in a civil way and helped with assisted suicide when needed', 'people that are terminally ill should be able to choose whether they want to have to live suffering or whether they want to end the pain ', 'people who are terminally ill and don t want to suffer any more have a right to ask for help to end their lives', 'it is more humane to help the person die than to let them suffer excruciating pain', 'when people are in unbearable pain and suffering and have no chance of getting better it is cruel to keep them alive without their consent', 'assisted suicide is sometimes the only solution for some people  we should not take it off ', 'assisted suicide allows people who have terrible health conditions to die with dignity  if assisted suicide is a crime they may have to endure many more years living in agony ', 'it helps relieve some people from tremendous suffering', 'it is unfair to force someone with a terminal illness to continue to suffer greatly when they are just dying anyway  the only humane and compassionate way to help them is to allow assisted suicide ', 'assisted suicide should be made legal many people suffer with debilitating and painful illnesses and should be counselled and supported to make an informed choice', 'a person should have the dignity to choose how they die', 'assisted suicide sometimes is the only thing that ends suffering ', 'if somebody is going to commit suicide anyway they should be able to do it safely with assistance', 'for those with degenerative diseases  assisted suicide is often the only solace they have', 'assited suicide allows those with a painful and terminal illness the ability to chose to end their life to cease the pain and suffering that would last for the end of their lives ', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense because when you get so sick with no hope left  one should be able to end the pain ', 'people with terminal illnesses are going to die  by not allowing assisted suicide we are making these people suffer deeply which in inhumane ', 'assisted suicide should be made legal so that those who have a terminal illness or are in uncurable pain can make an informed choice to end their lives with dignity surrounded by those they love ', 'people who are terminally ill and suffering greatly should have the right to end their own life if they so desire ', 'the right to die is a personal choice and everyone has the right to make it happen if they truly wish', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offense because when a person get gravely ill they should not have to keep on suffering ', 'assisted suicide should no be considered a criminal offence because a person could really be suffering and in pain and to let them suffer is heartless and inhumane', 'people should have the right to die if they choose ', 'people have the right to die on their own terms and in their own time', 'If a person is already diagnosed with only a short time to live and is undergoing excruciating pain  assisted death is a compassionate support for the person ', 'assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence because if someone doesn t want to live they shouldn t be forced to', 'assisted suicide usually involves a terminal medical patient that is tired of fighting and being in agony  they should be allowed to  check out  and receive help doing so ', 'assisted suicide shouldn t be a criminal offence if they are suffering from an incurable disease  they are going to die anyway', 'there is no reason for dying people to suffer unnecessarily', 'assisted suicide would save terminally i ll people pain and suffering ', 'many people face a cruel and protracted period of suffering before their death so with compassion they should be helped therefore assisted suicide should not be a criminal offence ', 'assisted suicide allows for a person who is sick and fully understanding what is done to end their pain when no quality of life can be assured', 'people must be able to decide what to do or not with their lives therefore assisted suicide is an alternative', 'people who have no hope of living should have a choice to end their life', 'many people are suffering terribly but are physically incapable of dying on their own', 'people should be allowed to die with dignity instead key_point: {'Assisted suicide gives dignity to the person that wants to commit it', 'The terminally ill would benefit from assisted suicide', 'People should have the freedom to choose to end their life', 'Assisted suicide reduces suffering'}

topic: Assisted suicide should be a criminal offence
argument: {'assisted suicide is murder of another and should be considered a criminal offence ', 'assisted suicide should not be an option just because people are in pain as there are other options to help with this', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because after they are dead no one will know what actually happened whether it was assisted suicide or if it was murder', 'assisted suicide is against the oath all doctors take ', 'assisted suicide is nothing but murder  you are giving a human the ability to legally kill another  this should be stopped  no person should be allowed to cause a death of another ', 'doctors take an oath to do no harm   assisting in suicide violates this', 'assisted suicide involves murdering someone which is illegal and should be treated as such ', 'an assisted suicide is just another way to murder a person  it does not matter if the person asked to be killed the person who does the killing has put one to death ', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because the person is basically killing the other person ', 'some vulnerable people might feel pressure to end their lives to ease their families  therefore  assisted suicide shouldn t be legal ', 'there s the possibility that it could be used by those close to the person for financial gain or maliciously  you only have the word of the survivor that the person actually wanted to die ', 'suicide should never be allowed and helping a person should be treated as murder  no person has the right to take a life  each person should be treated humanely and encouraged to live their natural life span ', 'the person assisting in an assisted suicide is committing murder and should be charged', 'assisting someone with suicide is equivalent to murder and that person has a moral obligation to report that persons intentions to authorities', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because people shouldn t be able to help murder others', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because killing is wrong whether it is willingly or not', 'suicide has never been legal  it is still killing  even if one is taking ones own life ', 'Giving someone the medicine to end a life other than natural causes is assisting in murder ', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offense because death is death  at the end of the day someone is dead and you had a hand in it ', 'assisted suicide is nothing short of murder and it should be a criminal offence ', 'assisted suicide is just like accessory to murder', 'it should be a criminal offense to assist in a suicide because of murder or pre meditated murder  People should die naturally not by suicide ', 'this is effectively commiting murder  no one has the right to take another person s life', 'helping someone to commit suicide is murder and should be criminalized', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because pain makes people do some extreme things  but it shouldn t include death ', 'ending a life is unlawful regardless of the reason ', 'Some people would fake assisted suicide to actually murder someone ', 'suicide is illegal and so is killing  so how is assisted suicide going to be legal ', 'assisted suicide is just another word for murder ', 'assisted suicide is still suicide  which is immoral in all forms ', 'no one should have the right to take a life ', 'assisted suicide is unethical how do we know that the person who is assisting the suicide hasnt got something to gain from the death of the other person', 'assisted suicide is heartless and inhumane', 'assisted suicide could be misused by people who want their weaker partner to die  people could be encouraged to take their own life before they really want to ', 'assisted suicide is too dangerous as if someone is weak and those that help should be punished ', 'assisted suicide is equivalent to murder and should be treated as such ', 'ending a life is a crime no matter the reason ', 'Legalizing assisted suicide may cause undo stress on other people with terminal illnesses  It might cause them to wonder if they are an undo burden on friends and family ', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence because it of murder and should be treated as a crime', 'assisted suicide is killing someone even if it is at their request', 'nobody has the right to take a life ', 'assisted suicide is immoral and a crime', ', 'assisted suicide should be a criminal offence for the god s law  god decide your life ', 'no one has the right to play god and decide to help another person to die ', 'assisted suicide should be a ', 'helping someone commit suicide is like killing them yourself ', 'The Hippocratic Oath states   First  do no harm    assisted suicide violates a doctor s duty not to do harm to a patient ', 'nobody these days and homeschooling allows parents to teach their children while keeping them safe at the same time ', 'homeschooling is an excellent alternative for children who are unable to attend normal why does it matter if that is at home or in a school  some children have needs that are not always met by a school such as learning difficulties  autism and anxiety', 'homeschooling is an excellent alternative to public schools for those parents who value family values ', 'homeschooling allows parents to teach using methods that are best suited to their child s way of learning', 'homeschooling absolutely should not be banned because parents have the freedom to raise their kids as they see fit  if they think they can do a better job teaching their children  they have every right to ', 'if parents feel they are best placed to educate their kids  they should be allowed to', 'many homeschool kids are smarter and learn more than kids in public school ', 'homeschooling can be appropriate with children  who have specific needs  for example  people with mental health or physical needs ', 'homeschooling programs use curricula similar to schools so that the kids will be just as prepared
